subject: Data
title: Graph Databases: When Relationships Are the Data
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Graph Databases: When Relationships Are the Data.

hook.text: Facebook needs to find friends-of-friends-of-friends. In SQL, that's three nested JOINs.

buildup.text: Graph databases like Neo4j store data as nodes and edges â€” optimized for traversing relationships.

discovery.text: They excel at social networks, fraud detection, and recommendation engines where connections matter most.

twist.text: Graph databases struggle with simple aggregations that relational databases handle easily.

climax.text: The rise of social media and knowledge graphs made relationship-first databases essential for modern applications.

punchline.text: Sometimes the relationship IS the data.

quiz.question: What are graph databases optimized for?
options: Traversing relationships between connected data points
